#Text=Canada 's Scarborough-Agincourt ( Ward 40 ) city council candidates speak
#Text=Friday , November 3 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontonians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is Scarborough-Agincourt ( Ward 40 ) .
#Text=One candidate responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include Sunny Eren , Norm Kelly ( incumbent ) , George Pappas , and Winston Ramjeet .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=Sunny Eren
#Text=37-year-old Sunny Eren is a System Analyst and Records Manager at the CAAT Pension Plan .
#Text=Q :
#Text=Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A :
#Text=I think the three most important issues facing my ward are ; Infrastructure/TTC services , Youth and Poverty .
#Text=Since amalgamation the roads and TTC have been failing to meet the demands of a growing city .
#Text=The city has grown by leaps and bounds and yet the only expansion has been the Sheppard Subway Line .
#Text=In a stop gap effort to resolve the demand versus capacity issue , the city has elected to put more buses on the street .
#Text=This lack of expansion with increased demand has led to only one outcome : more cars on the road with more traffic , pollution and aggravation .
#Text=Our roads were never designed to handle the volume we have now , which is the reason for the current sorry state of repair .
#Text=I feel that the youth have been alienated in our city with lack of parks and recreational spaces , which give young people a more robust life .
#Text=These people represent our future after all .

#Text=Finally , crime is important issue - I do feel that poverty feeds into a cycle and that proper support to help people rise out of poverty , along with engaging our youth , will have an effect of lowering crime .
#Text=Q :
#Text=What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=A :
#Text=To me TTC is one of the greatest issues facing our Ward ; we all need a strong and connected public transit .
#Text=It reduces pollution , traffic , and congestion .
#Text=It 's the primary means of transport for the majority of our Ward 's citizens .
#Text=People from the suburbs ride it through our Ward , and as the GTA increases in population , so too must the TTC expand .
#Text=Yet I feel it 's been stagnating , and it 's been a growing problem for a while now .
#Text=Q :
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=A :
#Text=I felt that I could no longer in good conscience just sit back and watch the city waste away , that I needed to do something to change the city for the better .
#Text=I know a lot of people love to sit and complain but I felt it would be better to actually try to make a difference .
#Text=That 's why I threw my name in for city Councillor .
#Text=Q :
#Text=Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=A :
#Text=This is where I live , I have my home here , and it is where my wife and I decided to start our life together .
#Text=I intend to start a family and raise my children .
#Text=Sure I could run in any Ward especially if there is no incumbent but this is where I am and this is where I want to change things .
#Text=Q :
#Text=How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=A :
#Text=Currently I sit on the Board of Directors of Streetlights .
#Text=It 's a non-profit charity that helps women escape prostitution and break the cycle of living in such a lifestyle .
#Text=I also sit on the board of directors in my condominium corporation , where I reside .
#Text=I have been involved in other activities such as raising money for the Hospital for Sick Children through a convention ( Anime North ) I helped put on .
#Text=Recently I have been helping different Chinese community groups secure volunteers and get their issues publicized .
#Text=Q :
#Text=Which council decision ( since the 2003 election ) do you feel the city/your ward should be most proud of , and which was least desirable ?
#Text=A :
#Text=Well number one is the pay raise .
#Text=Council voting itself a pay raise when the city is experiencing a budget crunch was not the best idea .
#Text=I do think the St. Clair right of way was a good idea but the public felt disenfranchised from the discussion of the issue .
#Text=People need to feel they have a say in the decision making .
#Text=Q :
#Text=Which council decision ( since the 2003 election ) do you feel the city/your ward should be most proud of , and which was least desirable ?
#Text=A :
#Text=Well number one is the pay raise , not only did the same council voted themselves a pay raise which despite the city is in a budget crunch was not the best idea .
#Text=I do think the St. Clair right of way was a nice idea but the public felt disenfranchised to the political process and thus rejected that idea .
#Text=I do endorse the City 's Bike Plan and Clean up the City initiatives , but I think the city should get a failing grade when it came down to the Budget and Garbage issue .
#Text=Q :
#Text=If you were elected as a " rookie " councillor , what would you bring to the table beyond the incumbent ?
#Text=A :
#Text=Well first off I am quite young and I believe that I represent the Ward not myself .
#Text=I intend to reach out to the community and try to meet everyone and help them .
#Text=I do n't belong to any network of old boys in a back room .
#Text=I have youth , energy and a stubborn determination to really try to help people .
#Text=In this way I can only hope to meet the needs and wants of everyone in my Ward .
#Text=That why I think I am the better choice for Ward 40 .
#Text=Q :
#Text=What does Toronto mean to you ?
#Text=A :
#Text=Well Toronto is my home , I have spent time in other cities in Asia and North America , but Toronto is where I feel safe and at home .
#Text=I truly believe Canada is the best country in the world and that Toronto is the best city within Canada .
